headline.main: Homegrown Zika Raises More Questions About the Evolving Risk
headline.print_headline: Homegrown Zika Raises More Questions About the Evolving Risk

docs.snippet: Homegrown mosquitoes apparently have infected four people in the Miami area with Zika and now it's up to tried-and-true public health measures to stamp out the birth defect-causing virus before it spreads....
docs.lead_paragraph: Homegrown mosquitoes apparently have infected four people in the Miami area with Zika and now it's up to tried-and-true public health measures to stamp out the birth defect-causing virus before it spreads.

headline.main: Delaware Judge Proposes October Trial Over Removal of Viacom Directors
headline.print_headline: Delaware Judge Proposes October Trial Over Removal of Viacom Directors

docs.snippet: A Delaware judge on Friday ruled that Sumner Redstone's lawyers must defend in a trial his move to oust five directors from Viacom Inc's board and suggested that he wants to get a better picture of the 93-year-old media mogul’s mental capaci...
docs.lead_paragraph: A Delaware judge on Friday ruled that Sumner Redstone's lawyers must defend in a trial his move to oust five directors from Viacom Inc's board and suggested that he wants to get a better picture of the 93-year-old media mogul’s mental capacity.

headline.main: U.S. Extends Oversight of Fiat Chrysler Safety Practices by a Year
headline.print_headline: U.S. Extends Oversight of Fiat Chrysler Safety Practices by a Year

docs.snippet: U.S. auto safety regulators said on Friday they were extending oversight of Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV for an additional year, requiring the Italian-American automaker to submit to monthly meetings and early disclosures of potential vehicle issu...
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. auto safety regulators said on Friday they were extending oversight of Fiat Chrysler Automobiles NV for an additional year, requiring the Italian-American automaker to submit to monthly meetings and early disclosures of potential vehicle issues.

headline.main: Russian Weightlifters Banned From Rio Olympics for Doping
headline.print_headline: Russian Weightlifters Banned From Rio Olympics for Doping

docs.snippet: All of Russia's weightlifters were banned from the Rio Olympics on Friday for doping for what the international federation called "extremely shocking" results that brought the sport into "disrepute."...
docs.lead_paragraph: All of Russia's weightlifters were banned from the Rio Olympics on Friday for doping for what the international federation called "extremely shocking" results that brought the sport into "disrepute."

headline.main: Monte Dei Paschi's Board Approves Private Backed Bailout-Board Member
headline.print_headline: Monte Dei Paschi's Board Approves Private Backed Bailout-Board Member

docs.snippet: The board of Monte dei Paschi di Siena approved on Friday a privately-backed bailout plan that includes a capital increase and the sale of a big chunk of its bad loans, board member Antonino Turicchi said....
docs.lead_paragraph: The board of Monte dei Paschi di Siena approved on Friday a privately-backed bailout plan that includes a capital increase and the sale of a big chunk of its bad loans, board member Antonino Turicchi said.

headline.main: Judge to Review Surveillance Video in Appling Gun Case
headline.print_headline: Judge to Review Surveillance Video in Appling Gun Case

docs.snippet: A Michigan judge will review surveillance footage from the night former Michigan State basketball player Keith Appling was arrested outside a strip club on weapons and drug charges....
docs.lead_paragraph: A Michigan judge will review surveillance footage from the night former Michigan State basketball player Keith Appling was arrested outside a strip club on weapons and drug charges.

headline.main: US Rig Count Up 1 This Week to 463
headline.print_headline: US Rig Count Up 1 This Week to 463

docs.snippet: The number of rigs exploring for oil and natural gas in the U.S. increased by one this week to 463....
docs.lead_paragraph: The number of rigs exploring for oil and natural gas in the U.S. increased by one this week to 463.

headline.main: Cheaper Oil Sends Exxon, Chevron to Worst Quarter in Years
headline.print_headline: Cheaper Oil Sends Exxon, Chevron to Worst Quarter in Years

docs.snippet: Cheaper oil is leading to the lowest summer gasoline prices in years, and it is causing heartburn for oil companies and their shareholders....
docs.lead_paragraph: Cheaper oil is leading to the lowest summer gasoline prices in years, and it is causing heartburn for oil companies and their shareholders.

headline.main: State Pact With Hershey Trust Would Limit Member Pay, Terms
headline.print_headline: State Pact With Hershey Trust Would Limit Member Pay, Terms

docs.snippet: State regulators and a $12 billion trust established by the founder of chocolate maker Hershey to educate poor children have announced a deal to revamp the trust's board and change its operating rules following reports about its lavish spending....
docs.lead_paragraph: State regulators and a $12 billion trust established by the founder of chocolate maker Hershey to educate poor children have announced a deal to revamp the trust's board and change its operating rules following reports about its lavish spending.

headline.main: Russian Athletes Affected by Rio Bans
headline.print_headline: Russian Athletes Affected by Rio Bans

docs.snippet: Following the International Olympic Committee's (IOC) decision on Sunday not to issue a blanket ban on Russian athletes despite evidence of systematic doping across the majority of Olympic sports, global sporting federations have been left to deci...
docs.lead_paragraph: Following the International Olympic Committee's (IOC) decision on Sunday not to issue a blanket ban on Russian athletes despite evidence of systematic doping across the majority of Olympic sports, global sporting federations have been left to decide which Russians can compete at next month's Rio Games.
